metadata.title: CVE-2024-27000 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: serial:mxs-auart: add spinlock around changing cts state Theuart_handle_cts_change() function in serial_core expects the caller to holduport->lock. For example, I have seen the below kernel splat, when theBluetooth driver is loaded on an i.MX28 board. [ 85.119255] ------------[cut here ]------------ [ 85.124413] WARNING: CPU: 0 PID: 27 at/drivers/tty/serial/serial_core.c:3453 uart_handle_cts_change+0xb4/0xec [85.134694] Modules linked in: hci_uart bluetooth ecdh_generic eccwlcore_sdio configfs [ 85.143314] CPU: 0 PID: 27 Comm: kworker/u3:0 Nottainted 6.6.3-00021-gd62a2f068f92 #1 [ 85.151396] Hardware name: FreescaleMXS (Device Tree) [ 85.156679] Workqueue: hci0 hci_power_on [bluetooth](...) [ 85.191765] uart_handle_cts_change frommxs_auart_irq_handle+0x380/0x3f4 [ 85.198787] mxs_auart_irq_handle from__handle_irq_event_percpu+0x88/0x210 (...)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27000` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:
